choices.answer: Carol Ann Duffy
Carol Ann Smith
Wilfred Owen
Seamus Heaney

questions.question: Why does Carol Ann Duffy present the photographer as relieved to be alone?

choices.answer: Because he needs time to think.
Because he is tired.
Because he does not like being around people.
Because he needs time to digest what he has witnessed.

questions.question: The photographer arranges the photographs into 'ordered rows' because...

choices.answer: ...he is suffering from OCD
...he wants to bring order to the chaos he's seen.
...he doesn't want to lose the photographs.
...he likes things that are neat.

questions.question: Carol Ann Duffy compares the photographer to a priest because...

choices.answer: ...she is a religious person.
...she thinks photographs are like a religion.
...she thinks photographs can carry a message like a mass.
...because she is a priest herself.
...life is fragile.  It can come and go.
...life will last forever.
...life is green.
...life is strong.

questions.question: Why did the photographer's hands not tremble when he took the photographs?

choices.answer: Because he wasn't moved by what he saw.
Because he has a steady hand.
Because he had to remain professional and get the job done.
Because he thought he would be told off.

questions.question: Which country was the photo 'Napalm Girl' taken in?

choices.answer: Cambodia
Vietnam
Japan
China

questions.question: Why does Carol Ann Duffy describe the image of the dying man as 'a half-formed ghost'?

choices.answer: Because the image is slowly developing in front of him.
Because the man is now dead so seems like a ghost.
Because the photographer finds the image haunting.
Because there is a ghost stood behind the dying man.

questions.question: Why do you think the wife allowed the photographer to take a picture of her dying husband?

choices.answer: Because she wanted the world to see his suffering.
Because she wanted to give the world a message.
Because she wanted to make the world stop and help.
Because she wanted a photograph of her husband.

questions.question: Why does the photographer describe his job as doing 'what someone must'?

choices.answer: He feels that the world must learn of the horrors of war.
He feels he has a responsibility.
He thinks more people should take up photography.
He feels he is the only person in the world who cares.
